title: A 2D and 3D cell culture protocol to study O-GlcNAc in sphingosine-1-phosphate mediated fibroblast contraction
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
2D contraction assay using NIH3T3 cells
Timing: 2 days
This step contains information on plating NIH3T3 cells, and treatment of the cells with either inhibitor and sphingosine-1-phosphate to initiate contraction. Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A shows a diagram of the layout of the different cell treatments.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1377-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Layout of the 6-well plates and the 24-well plates for the 2D and 3D contraction assays
(A) A schematic of the treatment of inhibitors and different concentrations of sphingosine-1-phosphate on NIH3T3 cells in the 2D contraction assay.
(B) A schematic of the treatment of inhibitors and different concentrations of sphingosine-1-phosphate on BJ-5ta cells in the 3D collagen gel contraction assay.
Seed NIH3T3 cells at 1 × 105 cells per well in 12 wells of two 6-well cell culture dishes 8 h prior to treatment with either small molecule inhibitors.
After 8 h, treat a 6-well dish of NIH3T3 cells with either DMSO vehicle, 5SGlcNAc (200 μM), or Thiamet-G (10 μM).
Allow cells to incubate for 16 h with 5SGlcNAc/DMSO or for 20 h with Thiamet-G/DMSO.
After the appropriate incubation, treat 1 well with DMSO as control and treat 5 wells of each plate with a S1P dose curve (0.05 μM, 0.1 μM, 0.5 μM, 1 μM, 5 μM) by pipetting it into the media (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A). Incubate the plate for 30 min.
After 30 min, take 5 representative images throughout each well by brightfield microscopy at 20× magnification.
Analyze the images by Adobe photoshop to find the change in cell area (see quantification protocol below).
3D contraction assay using BJ-5ta cells
Timing: 3 days

This step contains information on using a collagen gel contraction assay to evaluate the effect of inhibitors and sphingosine-1-phosphate on cell contraction in a tissue like environment. Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]B shows a diagram of the layout of the different cell treatments. This protocol was adapted from a procedure that can be found on the manufacturer’s website: https://www.cellbiolabs.com/cell-contraction-two-step-attached-model[href=https://www.cellbiolabs.com/cell-contraction-two-step-attached-model].
Suspend at least 7 × 106 BJ-5ta cells in fresh media at 2 × 106 cells per mL.
In a pre-chilled falcon tube, prepare the collagen solution on ice according to the ‘Collagen solution’ table above.
First add the collagen solution and 5× medium and mix well by gently pipetting up and down.
Add the neutralization solution and mix immediately.
Critical: Keep everything on ice to prevent premature polymerization of the solution. Make the solution right before plating out for the experiment.
Make a 4:1 mixture of collagen stock solution to cells in a pre-chilled 15 mL falcon tube and mix well.
To 12.936 mL of collagen solution, add 3.23 mL of BJ-5ta cells in media.
Pipette up and down carefully to avoid bubbles. Do not vortex.
Plate 500 μL of the cell collagen solution into 30 wells in two 24-well dishes.
Incubate the cell-collagen matrix at 37°C with 5% CO2 for 1 h to allow collagen polymerization to occur.
Note: It is difficult to determine whether polymerization is successful. Figure 7[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig7] shows a representative image of successful vs unsuccessful polymerization. Commonly, we discovered polymerization was unsuccessful when there was no contraction upon the addition of S1P.
After 1 h, add 1 mL of prewarmed media to each well.
Critical: Add the media very gently to prevent the matrix from detaching from the plate. Using a pipet, press the pipet tip against the wall of the well and depress the plunger slowly (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).

imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1377-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. How to carefully add media to the wells
A diagram showing how to correctly pipette 1 mL of media against the wall of the well onto the cell collagen matrix gently so as not to disturb the forming matrix (step 11).
Incubate the matrix at 37°C with 5% CO2 for 30 h.
After 30 h, supplement the wells with DMSO vehicle or with either 5SGlcNAc (200 μM) or Thiamet-G (10 μM).
Treat 15 wells with DMSO vehicle and 15 wells with 5SGlcNAc/Thiamet-G.
Incubate for an additional 16 h.
After incubation, carefully aspirate the liquid media out of the well and replace the media with serum-free media containing S1P (0.1–5 μM) or no S1P as a control.
Treat 6 wells with each concentration of S1P: 3 wells that were pre-treated with DMSO and 3 wells that were pre-treated with 5SGlcNAc.
Treat one row of 6 wells with DMSO as control.
Initiate contraction by gently releasing the sides and the bottom of the matrix from the plate using a 10 μL pipet tip.
Image the wells using a ChemiDoc XRS+ molecular imager (Bio-Rad) immediately after release (t = 0). Alternatively, images can be taken with any type of imager or the matrix can be measured with a ruler.
Incubate the matrix at 37°C for 30 min and then image the wells again (t = 30).
Quantify the change in diameter of each matrix using ImageJ (see quantification protocol below).
